23.text: looking out at that distant horizon,

31.text: that I'm going to make it all the way

34.text:
across that vast,
dangerous wilderness of an ocean.

39.text: Not only have I tried four times,

41.text:
but the greatest swimmers in the world
have been trying since 1950,

45.text: and it's still never been done.

49.text: The team is proud of our four attempts.

53.text: It's an expedition of some 30 people.

55.text: Bonnie is my best friend and head handler,

63.text:
that last drop of will within me,
when I think it's gone,

The shark experts
are the best in the world --

76.text:
The box jellyfish, the deadliest venom
in all of the ocean,

83.text:
and I have come close to dying from them

90.text:
besides the sheer distance
of over 100 miles in the open ocean --

95.text:
the currents and whirling eddies
and the Gulf Stream itself,

99.text:
the most unpredictable
of all of the planet Earth.

105.text: And by the way -- it's amusing to me

109.text:
that journalists and people,
before these attempts, often ask me,

114.text:
"Well, are you going to go with any boats
or any people or anything?"

119.text: And I'm thinking, what are they imagining?

121.text:
That I'll just sort of do
some celestial navigation --

125.text: And carry a bowie knife in my mouth,

129.text:
and I'll hunt fish and skin them
alive and eat them,

132.text:
and maybe drag a desalinization plant

150.text:
and brimming with innovation
and scientific discovery,

154.text:
as is true of any major
expedition on the planet.

160.text: And we've been on a journey.

162.text: And the debate has raged, hasn't it,

166.text: of isn't it what it's all about?

169.text:
Isn't life about the journey,
not really the destination?

174.text: And here we've been on this journey,

176.text: and the truth is, it's been thrilling.

178.text: We haven't reached that other shore,

180.text:
and still, our sense
of pride and commitment,

186.text:
When I turned 60,
the dream was still alive

190.text:
from having tried this in my 20s --
dreamed it and imagined it.

196.text:
The most famous body of water
on the Earth today, I imagine,

202.text: And it was deep. It was deep in my soul.

209.text:
it wasn't so much
about the athletic accomplishment,

212.text:
it wasn't the ego
of "I want to be the first."

215.text: That's always there and it's undeniable.

219.text: It was "how much life is there left?"

221.text:
Let's face it -- we're all
on a one-way street, aren't we?

225.text: And what are we going to do?

226.text:
What are we going to do as we go forward,
to have no regrets looking back?

232.text: And all this past year in training,

234.text: I had that Teddy Roosevelt quote

237.text:
to paraphrase it,
floating around in my brain.

241.text:
You go ahead and sit back
in your comfortable chair

244.text:
and you be the critic,
you be the observer,

248.text:
while the brave one
gets in the ring and engages

252.text:
and gets bloody and gets dirty and fails
over and over and over again,

257.text:
but yet isn't afraid and isn't timid
and lives life in a bold way."

262.text: And so of course I want to make it across.

265.text:
It is the goal, and I should
be so shallow to say that this year,

270.text:
the destination was even sweeter
than the journey.

279.text:
But the journey itself
was worthwhile taking.

282.text: And at this point, by this summer,

299.text:
It just simply can't be done,
and Bonnie said to me,

302.text: "But if you're going to take the journey,

304.text:
I'm going to see you
through to the end of it,

all my team is out in their boats,

this year, the mantra is --

and you have obstacles

369.text:
and she said, "Let's find

it was an intense,

381.text: The highs were high, the awe --

383.text:
I'm not a religious person,
but I'll tell you,

386.text: to be in the azure blue of the Gulf Stream

you're looking down miles
and miles and miles,

396.text:
to feel the majesty

405.text: I have a playlist of about 85 songs,

407.text:
and especially in the middle

409.text:
That night, because we use
no lights -- lights attract jellyfish,

414.text:
lights attract baitfish
that attract sharks,

416.text: so we go in the pitch black of the night.

418.text: You've never seen black this black.

422.text: You can't see the front of your hand,

424.text:
and the people on the boat,
Bonnie and my team on the boat --

427.text: they just hear the slapping of the arms,

429.text: and they know where I am,

430.text: because there's no visual at all.

432.text:
And I'm out there kind of tripping out
on my little playlist.

439.text:
I've got tight rubber caps,
I don't hear a thing.

442.text:
I've got goggles and I'm turning
my head 50 times a minute,

457.text:
And I can sing that song
a thousand times in a row.

462.text: Now there's a talent unto itself.

469.text: And each time I get done with,

471.text:
(Singing) Oh, you may say I'm a dreamer

486.text: And when I get through the end

496.text: And then there are the crises.

500.text:
And the vomiting starts,

504.text:
You're wearing a jellyfish mask

509.text:
It's causing abrasions

512.text: but the tentacles can't get you.

517.text:
The water's 85 degrees,
and yet you're losing weight

522.text:
And as you come over
toward the side of the boat --

524.text:
not allowed to touch it,
not allowed to get out,

526.text: but Bonnie and her team hand me nutrition

532.text: I am seeing the Taj Mahal --

537.text: I'm in a very different state --

I never thought I'd be running

551.text:
I mean, how long
did it take them to build that?

562.text: We kind of have a cardinal rule

564.text:
that I'm never told how far it is,

568.text:
What's going to happen to you
between this point and that point?

571.text:
What's going to happen
to the weather and the currents

575.text:
when you don't think you could

Bonnie made a decision

586.text: and I was hanging on by a thread.

591.text:
and I came close

and I said, "It's going

613.text:
which for most swimmers

622.text:
You have no idea how many

626.text:
So here we go, and I somehow,
without a decision,

630.text: went into no counting of strokes

634.text:
and no quoting Stephen Hawking

I just went into thinking

646.text: As I said, when I turned 60,

it wasn't about that concrete

655.text:
That's the discipline,
and it's the preparation,

658.text: and there's a pride in that.

664.text:
about -- you know, the phrase usually is,

668.text:
And in my case,
it's reaching for the horizon.

671.text: And when you reach for the horizon,

673.text: as I've proven, you may not get there.

676.text:
But what a tremendous build
of character and spirit

684.text:
what a foundation you lay down

689.text: And now, the shore is coming.

692.text:
And there's just a little part

695.text: The epic journey is going to be over.

697.text: So many people come up to me now and say,

706.text: When are you going to do the next one?

708.text: We can't wait to follow the next one."

715.text:
And so there won't be another

718.text: But the point is, and the point was,

727.text:
And I'll tell you,
when I walked up onto that beach,

731.text:
I had so many times,

748.text:
to say, "She's really beginning

755.text:
the whole thing -- I just thought,

just to get myself through some

805.text:
What's the phrase

So I don't stand up and say,

823.text:
Sixty-four; a thing no one,

829.text: And there's no doubt in my mind

844.text:
And the third thing

846.text:
it looks like the most solitary

848.text: and in many ways, of course, it is.

And in other ways,

855.text:
And if you think I'm a badass,

873.text: The Henry David Thoreau quote goes,

875.text:
"When you achieve your dreams,

881.text: And yeah, I stand before you now.

883.text: In the three months since that swim ended,

887.text:
and I've been in

I've been invited to speak

895.text:
I've signed a wonderful

897.text:
All of that's great,
and I don't denigrate it.

900.text: I'm proud of it all, but the truth is,

903.text:
because I am that bold, fearless person,

909.text: until it's time for these days to be done.

Thank you very much
